thread.title_full: Shifting South: Political trends that shape the region | www.ajc.com

author: Greg Bluestein
title: Shifting South: Political trends that shape the region | www.ajc.com
text:
This is an occasional series by The Atlanta Journal-Constitution that explores the political currents that define our region.
Some of them are being shaped by Georgia, some of them are shaping Georgia and some of them are soon to be shaping Georgia.
From calls for tax increases in Georgia, Alabama and South Carolina to the promise a conservative “awakening” from evangelical leaders , the shifting south explores the issues that will resonate in the south for years to come.
Jonathan Phillips Veronica Fuller (center) hugs Ameshia Ervin (left) after graduating from the theological studies certficate program at the Lee Arrendale Correctional Facility in Alto on Friday, April 10, 2015. 43 inmates received their certificates on Friday at the state prison. JONATHAN PHILLIPS / SPECIAL Click on any yellow point on the map to see a story about the shifting south.
